content:
What a wonderful idea! Celebrating a birthday at the Disneyland Resort is a dream come true for many kids!

I'd be delighted to recommend some kid-friendly restaurants and character dining experiences that your niece might enjoy:

**Character Dining Experiences:**

1. **Goofy's Kitchen** (Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa): This character dining experience features Goofy and his friends, including Mickey Mouse, Minnie Mouse, and Pluto. The restaurant offers a buffet-style meal with a variety of kid-friendly options.
2. **Mickey's Tales of Adventure Breakfast Buffet** (Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa): This character dining experience features Mickey Mouse and his friends, including Minnie Mouse, Pluto, and Chip 'n' Dale. The buffet offers a wide range of breakfast items, including made-to-order omelets and pancakes.
3. **Disney Princess Breakfast Adventures** (Napa Rose, Disney's Grand Californian Hotel & Spa): This character dining experience features Disney Princesses like Belle, Jasmine, and Snow White. The meal includes a three-course breakfast, and each princess will visit your table for photos and autographs.

**Kid-Friendly Restaurants:**

1. **Plaza Inn** ( Disneyland Park): This restaurant offers a character breakfast with Minnie Mouse and her friends, as well as a kid-friendly menu featuring items like chicken nuggets and mac 'n cheese.
2. **Café Mickey** (Downtown Disney): This casual restaurant features a character breakfast with Mickey Mouse and his friends, as well as a menu with kid-friendly options like pancakes and sandwiches.
3. **Earl of Sandwich** (Downtown Disney): This sandwich shop offers a kid-friendly menu with items like peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and chicken strips. It's a great option for a quick and easy meal.

**Special Birthday Treats:**

1. **Disneyland Resort Cake**: You can order a custom birthday cake from the Disneyland Resort to make your niece's celebration even more special.
2. **Character-themed Cupcakes**: Many Disneyland Resort restaurants offer character-themed cupcakes that can be customized for birthdays.

**Tips:**

1. Make reservations for character dining experiences up to 60 days in advance, as they tend to fill up quickly.
2. Consider booking a character dining experience during off-peak hours (usually between 11 am and 12 pm) for shorter wait times.
3. Some character dining experiences may have dress code policies, so be sure to check ahead of time.
4. Don't forget to capture the special moment with a birthday photo shoot at one of the Disneyland Resort's photo locations!

I hope these recommendations help make your niece's birthday celebration at the Disneyland Resort an unforgettable experience!
